title: Getting Started with React Native: A Beginnerâ€™s Guide to Building Your First Project
excerpt: A beginner-friendly guide to help you start your journey with React Native and build your first mobile app with ease.
content:
Introduction

React Native is a popular open-source framework that allows you to build mobile apps using JavaScript and React. Whether you're a web developer or a complete beginner, React Native makes it easier than ever to create high-quality cross-platform applications.

Why Choose React Native?

  • Cross-Platform: One codebase for both Android and iOS.
  • Community Support: A vibrant developer community and tons of libraries.
  • Hot Reloading: See your changes in real-time without rebuilding.

Prerequisites

Before you get started, make sure you have the following installed:

  1. Node.js and npm
  2. Expo CLI (for easier development)
  3. VS Code or any code editor

Step-by-Step Guide

Step 1: Install Expo CLI

npm install -g expo-cli

Step 2: Create a New Project

expo init MyFirstApp

Choose the blank template when prompted.

Step 3: Run the App

cd MyFirstApp
npm start

This will launch a development server. You can now view your app on a phone using the Expo Go app.

Conclusion

React Native is a great way to get started in mobile development. With a few tools and some practice, you'll be building fully functional apps in no time. Stay tuned for more tutorials!

Watch this step-by-step video tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0-S5a0eXPoc
author: Satyam kumar singh
